ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Reality and the Realistic covered a breadth of readings in the history of art, philosophy, religion, and literature that changed the way I analyze and read texts from a psychological framework that takes in how I see each piece of information in my real life. I learned ways to justify my point of view and also understand the perspective of others. What I learned from this is that humanity has various ways of taking in and creating from reality and that there is no one right way to think of it. It also helped me learn to ask more profound questions and have a reason behind all my views.

This class provides an opportunity to examine how we examine art, existence, imagination, and ourselves as things that exist and seem to exist. It allows students the chance to closely examine things perhaps closer than ever. It is a class that allows us to challenge our assumptions, indulge our assumptions, and search for what and why we assume what we assume.

This course taught me to think about reality and my daily life in very different terms. I learned a lot about the different ways to distinguish the real from the unreal and how to tangle with the messiness of reality. I found the work engaging and helpful in my life even beyond the classroom.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course are the variety of readings and the class discussion and activities that brought us together as a group and practice what understanding reality means. Unfortunately, this also is the weakness of the course in that I feel like we touched on so many topics that were hyper-niche in their way, but that felt very disjointed at times and hard to connect. I feel like it could have been better with more focus on one thing in the class design.
needs a narrower reading list, clearer trajectory, more focused both the professors really had perceptive points and good insights but the material was hard to read in a patchwork of excerpts

I thought the readings were engaging and the projects were focused on our personal development throughout the course. I loved the structure of the papers in this class and thought it was well planned to allow students to embrace the dense content as best they can in the time we had together.

Strengths: good peer discussion

Weakness: poor clarity

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the course to anyone who is excited by thinking about epistemology or non-epistemological existence. It is a class that, from my experience, gets talked about by students outside of class to peers and otherwise.

Depends on what they want out of it. It was enjoyable and exposed me to lots of new writers and disciplines, but it's also such a broad and ill-defined topic that this felt like meandering through different fields and unrelated or contradictory thoughts week to week. I struggled with this a bit, but it was still interesting. Profs. Khawaja and Fiduccia are both wonderful -- thoughtful, engaging, fun in class. Readings were interesting and the three short papers very reasonable.

I absolutely would recommend this course to other students. I think, even if you are not a student very interested in philosophy, any person could find something valuable to take away from this course. This course has helped me to develop my outlook on life and will continue to impact how I choose to live each day. I am so glad I took this course!
I would not recommend this course. The course started strong, but started to become muddled and directionless soon after. Papers were not handed back In a timely manner.
